buildingTypes.name: Single Tenant Office
buildingTypes.description: Office space occupied by a single tenant for professional or commercial purposes.
buildingTypes.typicalUse: Corporate offices, legal firms, accounting services, government agencies
buildingTypes.notes: General medical practitioner offices are typically Class 5 unless medical treatment leaves patients non-ambulatory, in which case classified as Class 9a.

buildingTypes.name: Multi Tenant Office
buildingTypes.description: Office building with multiple tenants sharing common spaces.
buildingTypes.typicalUse: Commercial office buildings, business centers, co-working spaces

buildingTypes.name: Small Retail
buildingTypes.description: Retail spaces under 500m² for direct sale of goods/services to the public.
buildingTypes.typicalUse: Shops, cafés, hairdressers, kiosks, funeral parlours
buildingTypes.notes: Service stations are Class 6, but auto repair workshops are Class 8.

buildingTypes.name: Large Retail
buildingTypes.description: Retail spaces over 500m² or shopping centers with multiple tenants.

buildingTypes.name: Single Dwelling
buildingTypes.description: Standalone or attached dwellings for domestic use.
buildingTypes.notes: Class 1b includes hostels <300m² with <12 residents; larger facilities are Class 3.

buildingTypes.name: Multi Unit Residential
buildingTypes.typicalUse: Apartments, flats, units above a shared basement/carpark

buildingTypes.name: Hospitality
buildingTypes.description: Buildings for transient or long-term accommodation of unrelated persons.
buildingTypes.typicalUse: Hotels, hostels, backpackers, workers' quarters, aged care (non-Class 9c)
buildingTypes.notes: Class 3 excludes owner-occupied residences (Class 1/2) and Class 9c care facilities.

buildingTypes.name: Healthcare
buildingTypes.description: Buildings for medical treatment where patients may require evacuation assistance.
buildingTypes.typicalUse: Hospitals, clinics with day surgery, health labs

buildingTypes.name: Education
buildingTypes.description: Assembly buildings for social, educational, or civil purposes.
buildingTypes.typicalUse: Schools, universities, childcare centers, sports stadiums

buildingTypes.name: Residential Care
buildingTypes.description: Buildings providing long-term care with physical assistance needs.
buildingTypes.typicalUse: Aged care facilities, disability care homes
commonFeatures: Emergency evacuation plans for non-ambulatory residents
buildingTypes.notes: Class 9c requires ≥10% of residents to need physical assistance for daily activities/evacuation.

buildingTypes.name: Industrial
buildingTypes.description: Buildings for production, storage, or wholesale display.
buildingTypes.notes: Farm buildings vary by use (e.g., Class 10a for small sheds, Class 7/8 for large-scale operations).

buildingTypes.name: Mixed Use Building
buildingTypes.description: Buildings with multiple classifications (e.g., retail + residential).
buildingTypes.typicalUse: Apartment over retail, office with basement carpark
buildingTypes.notes: Ancillary spaces ≤10% of floor area may adopt the primary classification.

buildingTypes.name: Non-Habitable Structures
buildingTypes.description: Structures not intended for human occupation.
